                                 Wireless News

                           October 25, 2014 Saturday



BODY:

120 Sports reported that it will provide content to MSN.

The newly re-designed and re-launched MSN experience will now feature 120
Sports' video content & video player as a part of its sports video offerings,
the company noted in a release.

"This integration with Microsoft is yet another step for the 120 Sports brand as
we continue to expand our audience and reach more fans," said 120 Sports
president Jason Coyle. "MSN has developed a strong and loyal sports following
and we are excited that our content will be featured as a part of their new
offerings."

120 Sports said guests to MSN, both on the web and mobile, will now have access
to 120 Sports' on-demand, real-time video content including original hosted
programming, breaking news, video highlights and analysis across all sports.

120 Sports' live programming will also be hosted on the site shortly.

Currently, 120 Sports noted that it produces 76 hours of weekly live content in
a newly conceptualized two-minute format, ...

...world and everyday life," said Amanda Morgan, Senior Director at Microsoft.
"We are pleased to integrate the unique and fantastic content from 120 Sports as
part of our commitment to provide our users with content from some of the
world's best and most authoritative media sources, data and services to enable
users to do more."

120 Sports is a network partnership involving multiple leagues and media
properties.

More information:

www.120sports.com

((Comments on this ...
headline: 120 Sports to Provide Content to Microsoft's Redesigned MSN Experience
